content.value: protected SerializationHelper()
Protected Sub New()

children.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

content.value: public void AddRegisteredSerializers(Assembly assembly, List<string>? warnings = null)
Public Sub AddRegisteredSerializers(assembly As Assembly, warnings As List(Of String) = Nothing)

parameters.description: The assembly to get registrations from
An optional collection to receive warnings generated during the registration

children.remarks:
The warnings collection will include warnings in the following circumstances:

  • When the serializer type that does not implement
  • When the registration contains no support types to serialize
  • When a supported type to serialize is duplicated with another serializer
  • When a supported type is covered by a built-in serializer
  • An exception is thrown while creating the serializer
children.summary: Add serializers that have been registered in the given assembly.

content.value: protected void AddSerializers(IRegisterXunitSerializerAttribute[] registrations, List<string>? warnings = null)
Protected Sub AddSerializers(registrations As IRegisterXunitSerializerAttribute(), warnings As List(Of String) = Nothing)

parameters.description: An optional collection to receive warnings generated during the registration

children.remarks:
The warnings collection will include warnings in the following circumstances:

  • When the serializer type that does not implement
  • When the registration contains no support types to serialize
  • When a supported type to serialize is duplicated with another serializer
  • When a supported type is covered by a built-in serializer
  • An exception is thrown while creating the serializer
children.summary: Add serializers to the supported serializer list.

content.value: public bool IsSerializable(object? value)
Public Function IsSerializable(value As Object) As Boolean

parameters.description: The object to test for serializability.

return.description: Returns true if the object can be serialized; false, otherwise.

children.remarks: As null values always return true, even if the underlying type (which is unknown) might not be serializable, it's better to test via whenever possible.
children.summary: Determines if an object instance is serializable.

content.value: public bool IsSerializable(object? value, Type? type)
Public Function IsSerializable(value As Object, type As Type) As Boolean

parameters.description: The object to test for serializability.
The type to test for serializability.

return.description: Returns true if objects of the given type can be serialized; false, otherwise.

children.summary: Determines if a given type supports serialization.

return.description: The instance of the , if available; null, otherwise.

children.summary: Converts a type name (in "TypeName" format for mscorlib types, or "TypeName,AssemblyName" format for all others) into a object.

parameters.description: The type to get the name for

children.summary: Gets an assembly qualified type name for serialization.

summary: Serializes and de-serializes objects. It supports a limited set of built-in types, as well as anything which implements . Custom serializers can implement and register by decorating the test assembly with .
